column2: Y'know, I can't believe I'm getting my nails done!\xc2\xa0 And you\nsaid it was gonna be fun! (pause) Which it kinda is.\xc2\xa0 Also, you said there would be\nother guys here. There are no other guys here!"
Chandler, there\xc2\x92s a guy right over there. (Points to the counter)'
That\xc2\x92s a mailman! That\xc2\x92s our mailman! (Waves to the\nmailman) (Sarcastic) Hi. How are ya?'

Chandler, don\xc2\x92t worry! This doesn\xc2\x92t make you any less of a
guy! (Chandler starts blowing on his fingernails like women do.) That does!
(Chandler stops blowing.) What am I sitting on? (She looks and finds a huge nail.) I hate
to think what this woman was scratching when this broke off.'
Hey, you know who used to have nails like that?'
Hmm.'
OH\xc2\x85MY\xc2\x85GAWD!! (Yep, you guessed it. It\xc2\x92s Janice.)'
Joey let me ask you a question. What does this light switch do?'
Ohh, Nothing.'
Didn\xc2\x92t it drive you crazy to have a switch and not know what it\ndid?'
I know what it did! Nothing.'
They wouldn\xc2\x92t have put it there if it didn\xc2\x92t do something! How\ncan you not care?'
Like this. (Shrugs)'
Well, here\xc2\x92s another question for ya. Uhh, do you know what that\nsilver knob on the toilet does?'
Sure! It flushes it.'
Okay, good. Now that since you know, when you come over would you mind\nactually using it?'
(entering, with Janice in tow) Hello!'
Hey! (Sees Janice.) Ah!! (Janice screams in surprise.)'
Guess who we ran into today?!'
Janice?!'
Isn\xc2\x92t this amazing? '
How have you been?'
Oh well, I\xc2\x92m divorced.'
Ohhh, wow.'
Yeah, I\xc2\x92m riding the alimony pony. (Does the now famous laugh.)'
And there it is.'
I just came up to say, "Hi!" Hi! (to Chandler) And you,\nsweetie, I\xc2\x92ll see you tonight.'
Okay. Bye.'
Bye.'
Bye.'
Bye.'
Bye.'
Bye.'
B-bye!'
Bye-bye.'
Bye. (Finally closes the door on her.) (After it\xc2\x92s closed) I\ncan\xc2\x92t stand the woman! (Phoebe is shocked, Joey is relieved.)'
What?! I thought you were crazy about her!'

Yeah, I know, but all of those little annoying things she did before\nwe fell in love? Like her voice, her laugh, her personality\xc2\x97Well, they\xc2\x92re all\nback! Y\xc2\x92know? And she\xc2\x92s picked up like nine new ones!'
So what are you doing bringing her here?! There\xc2\x92s people here!'
Don\xc2\x92t worry about it. I\xc2\x92m taking care of it tonight.\n(Chandler opens the fridge and grabs something to drink.)'
You are not. You have never been able to break up with her.'

(standing in the door of the fridge) Well, I don\xc2\x92t have to break
up with her this time. We\xc2\x92re not involved! I\xc2\x92m going to do a pre-emptive strike!
I\xc2\x92m going to end it with her before it starts. My ass is like frozen! (Closes the
fridge.) '
Yeah, try sticking it in the freezer for 20 minutes. (They all look around\nand then back at Joey.) I\xc2\x92m tellin\xc2\x92 ya!'
I can\xc2\x92t believe you really walk alone here! I mean, you hear such\nstories about New York.'
No, it\xc2\x92s really not that bad. I mean, I-I for one, feel perfectly\nsafe.'
Help! Help!! Help! Help!!'
No, no, no Ross! Ross, these are friends of mine from home. (Introducing\nthem) Liam, Devon, this is Ross.'
Hey, mate.'
How are ya man?'
Oh hey, that was a good one, huh? (Imitating himself) Help! Help!'
So how are you? I\xc2\x92ve been meaning to ring you ever since I arrived\nbut umm, well, I\xc2\x92ve been rather busy.'
Do you realise that we have not seen each other since the night of that\nU2 concert?'
Oh my God. I think you\xc2\x92re right.'
(puts his arm around her) Well, actually the last time you and I saw each\nother was that morning.'
Oh, Liam. (Ross laughs and takes her back.)'
Oh, Liam. So uh, what, were you guys playing soccer or something\xc2\x97or\nshould I call it (In an English accent) football?'
We were playing rugby.'
In fact we\xc2\x92re playing a game at the park tomorrow. You\xc2\x92re\nwelcome to play too if you want.'
(laughs) Ross play rugby? I don\xc2\x92t think so.'
What\xc2\x92s ah, what\xc2\x92s so funny about that?'
Well I mean, you\xc2\x92re American to start with. You don\xc2\x92t even have\nrugby here.'
Well, we didn\xc2\x92t have freedom here until 1776, either so\xc2\x85'
So good then! We\xc2\x92ll see you at Riverside Park at 2
Cheers!'
Cheers!'
Oh boy, I just love to sing!'
Yes, I-I know that you do, but I think one of the reasons people were\ncomplaining though, was that they paid to hear the actor sing Old Man River.'
Oh, look at us! Who would\xc2\x92ve thought that Cupid had a station at\n14th Street Nails. (Does the laugh)'
(laughs) Okay, we have to talk. I\xc2\x92m just getting out of a very\nserious relationship\xc2\x85'
I know! And I\xc2\x92m just getting out of a marriage, I mean talk about\nmeant to be!'
Right! I just think that this is happening too soon.'
Oh, too soon, too schmoon. Face it honey, I am not letting you get away\nthis time.'
I hear ya. (Pause) But! Unfortunately, my company is transferring me\noverseas!'
Oh no! Where to? (Gasps) Too Paris?'
No! No! Not, Paris. '
Too London? No-no, Rome? Vienna? Ooh-ooh, Barcelona?'
Okay, could you just stop talking for a second? (Thinks) Yemen.\nThat\xc2\x92s right, yes, I\xc2\x92m being transferred to Yemen!'
When?'
I don\xc2\x92t know exactly.'
Ugh, well I will just have to soak up every once of Chandler Bing until\nthat moment comes.'
But I do know that it\xc2\x92s some time tomorrow.'
Done?'
Yep!'
(entering, with Joey) Hey!'
Hey! What\xc2\x92s up?'

This switch thing has been driving me crazy. So I turned it off and
checked every outlet. Now, four of them don\xc2\x92t work. Which means, one of them
has to be controlled by the switch. So, I plugged in things in all four of the outlets
that-that make noise, so that way, when I turn it on I just follow the noise and find out
which one it is.'
(to Rachel) I bet I stopped listening before you did.'
Y\xc2\x92know, you-you also could\xc2\x92ve used uh, lamps and then\nfollowed the light.'

Yeah, well, I\xc2\x92m using noise. Okay. All right! So, is everybody\nready? Here we go. (She flips on the switch and a hum starts.) I hear something! I hear\nsomething! Where is it? (They all start looking until Rachel realises it\xc2\x92s Joey.)'
It\xc2\x92s coming from Joey!'
Oh my God, that\xc2\x92s so freaky! Turn him off!!'
Ooh, hey, could we put on the news? I think it might be raining.'
Oh, just hold on a second. I\xc2\x92m watching this rugby thing on ESPN.\nI don\xc2\x92t know what the big deal is. I\xc2\x92m man enough to play this sport.'
Dude, you\xc2\x92re not even man enough to order the channel that\ncarries the sport.'
(entering) Hey there Ross!'
(shocked) Hey!'
(whispering to Ross) Janice.'
Y\xc2\x92know uh, you didn\xc2\x92t really have to help me pack.'
Ohh, well when you said all you were going to be doing between now and\nthe time you leave is packing, you didn\xc2\x92t really leave me much choice. Did you?'
Well, I-I thought I did but, I-I guess I did not!'
Hey-hey, what\xc2\x92s going on?'
Oh, I\xc2\x92m packing. Y\xc2\x92know I\xc2\x92m-I\xc2\x92m packing\n\xc2\x91cause I\xc2\x92m moving to Yemen tomorrow.'
Thanks for telling me!'
I\xc2\x92m only going to pretend I\xc2\x92m moving to Yemen, it\xc2\x92s the\nonly way I can get rid off her.'
Ohhhh, good one! And Yemen that actually sounds like a real country.'
(leaning in from the bedroom) Chandler! Come on, I\xc2\x92m gonna show how\nto roll up your underwear and stuff it in your shoes. It\xc2\x92s a real space saver.'
Yeah, I know, I do that \xc2\x91cause it makes me look taller.'
Okay, Chandler, come on!'
(to Janice) Okay. (to Joey) Joey, trade lives with me!'
Nope. (To Ross) Man look at this! Ross, I can\xc2\x92t believe you said\nyou\xc2\x92d play rugby. I mean look how brutal this is!'
Hey, I can handle it! All right?'
Please, Ross, you-you got hurt playing badminton with my dad.'
That\xc2\x92s \xc2\x91cause-\xc2\x91cause you\xc2\x92re mom\xc2\x92s dog kept-kept\nlooking at me.'
(pointing to the TV) Okay, Ross, look-look-look-look, look right here.\nThat\xc2\x92s called a scrum, okay? It\xc2\x92s kinda like a huddle.'
And is a hum, kinda like a scruddle?'
Ross! (Laughs) They\xc2\x92re gonna kill you!'
Well, why are you doing this anyway?'
Well, you should\xc2\x92ve seen the guy that she used to go out with. I\nmean, he\xc2\x92s like Joe Rugby.'
You\xc2\x92re kidding! And he plays rugby?! That\xc2\x92s so funny.\n(Realises) Ohh! I see how you did that. All right.'
Anyway, she thought the very idea of me playing rugby with him was\nlike hilarious. So I\xc2\x92m gonna show her how tough I really am!'
(starts laughing, Ross stares at her) I\xc2\x92m sorry. I\xc2\x92m sorry.\nYou\xc2\x92re right, you are a tough guy. You\xc2\x92re the toughest palaeontologist I know.'
All right, come on look, Ross can take care of himself! It\xc2\x92s not like\nhe\xc2\x92s\xc2\x85Chandler!'
(from his bedroom) Thanks!'

Look, don\xc2\x92t worry about me. Okay? I\xc2\x92ll just stay real energetic\nand stay away from the ball. I\xc2\x92ll uh, I\xc2\x92ll be that guy right out of the circle.\n(He points to a player who starts running and then gets viscously tackled from behind.)'
Oh!'
Oh, well maybe there was a dog lookin\xc2\x92 at him.'
Ross-Ross-Ross-Ross! Stay away from that guy (Points), and that guy\n(Points). And that one\xc2\x97Dude! They\xc2\x92re all huge!'
They don\xc2\x92t look any bigger than me!'
Well, maybe that\xc2\x92s because you\xc2\x92re closer to you. So you look\nbigger to you from where you are.'
I\xc2\x92m just going to say hi to the lads. All right?'
All right.'
Okay. (Goes to say hi to the lads.) '
(to the player) Hi.'
Whoa! (The player leaves and to Joey) I kinda liked it.'
Okay, I know what I have to do. I\xc2\x92ve got to go Red Ross. (Joey and\nPhoebe don\xc2\x92t know what he\xc2\x92s talking about.) Y\xc2\x92know, Red Ross!'
I totally don\xc2\x92t know what you\xc2\x92re talking about.'
Come on! The time we were all waiting in line for Dances With Wolves and\nthat one guy cut in line in front of us and I just lost it?! Screamed at him! Turned all\nred! Red Ross!!'
No.'
You\xc2\x92ll see.'
Liam, do me a favour. Tell the lads to go easy on Ross, it\xc2\x92s his\nfirst time.'
You don\xc2\x92t say! (We see Ross who is hopping about with the ball and\nspikes it in his face.)'
(to Ross) Good luck, babe.'
Ross! Ross! Come on! Get in here! (Ross gets pumped up.) Ross! Come on!'
Ross, come on! Get in the bloody scrum! Ross, get in!'
You\xc2\x85are\xc2\x85not going to believe it! Joshua came into work today,\nand guess what happened?'
He asked you out?!'
No. But I was showing him some cufflinks and I felt his pulse.'
Saucy!'
(refers to the table) What are these?'
Electrical plans for the building.'
Okay, okay, okay should I be scared?'
I know that switch does something, okay? So-so I went down to city hall\nand got these. All I had to do was pay $25 and wait in line for three hours.'
Wow! If only more people knew.'
Y\xc2\x92know you, really didn\xc2\x92t have to take me to the airport.'

Oh please. Every moment is precious. Y\xc2\x92know? Besides, somebody had\nto ride in that other taxi with the rest of your luggage, and your friends don\xc2\x92t\nreally seem to care too much that you\xc2\x92re leaving.'
Well, we\xc2\x92re really not that close. (Pause) Okay, so I guess this\nis uh, good-bye then.'
On no! No! It\xc2\x92s not good-bye, I\xc2\x92m not leaving until you get on\nthat plane.'
Okay. Then I guess it\xc2\x92s just, wait here then. (Hands her the sign\nthat says, Wait Here.") (To the ticket agent) Hi. I need one fake ticket to Yemen.'
One ticket to Yemen?'
Oh no-no-no, no. No, no, no, I just, I just need a pretend ticket.'
I\xc2\x92m sorry sir, I don\xc2\x92t understand. '
What would you give to a kid if he wanted a ticket to play with?'
Are you travelling with a child?'
No. All right, y\xc2\x92know what, she\xc2\x92s (Points to Janice) gonna\nthink that I\xc2\x92m handing you a credit card, but what I\xc2\x92m really gonna do is hand\nyou a library card.'
Ah, sir a ticket to Yemen is $2,100 and we don\xc2\x92t\ntake library cards.'
What\xc2\x92s the matter? Is something wrong? Do you have to stay?'
(to the ticket agent) American Express?'
I can\xc2\x92t believe they\xc2\x92re doing that to him! I told them to go\neasy on him!'
No offence but, y\xc2\x92know sometimes it\xc2\x92s hard to understand you,\ny\xc2\x92know with the accent, so\xc2\x85'
That\xc2\x92s just halftime, there\xc2\x92s more of this.'
Did you see me? I was pretty good, huh? That is one fun game!'
Right.'
(to Emily) Hey, could you do me a favour? Could you just grab me a bottle\nof water? '
Okay.'
Thanks. (When she\xc2\x92s gone he collapses into Joey.) I-I think I\xc2\x92m\ndying. I really do. '
Oh, poor baby.'
(to Phoebe) Tell my son that I love him. (Emily returns with the water.)\nExcellent! Well, okay, I gotta have some more fun!'
Ross, they are killing you out there!'
(whines "No.") That\xc2\x92s not true!'
She\xc2\x92s right! You have to stop!'
What? No! No, I\xc2\x92m not stopping. I\xc2\x92m Red Ross!'
Dude, if you go back out there, you\xc2\x92re gonna be Dead Ross!'
I don\xc2\x92t care! I am not quitting! I insist on finishing this game!'
All right, all right, if you insist on doing this, at least let me help\nyou.'
No, God no! That is no place for a woman. Those guys will grab anything.'
No. That\xc2\x92s not what I\xc2\x92m saying. I just may know a few things\nthat might help you inflict some pain.'
I like that.'
Yeah? Listen closely, Devon has got a weak ankle. '
Huh?'
One swift kick and he\xc2\x92ll back off.'
All right, bad ankle, got it!'
And that big bloke with the beard, he has got a trick hip. Yeah. And uh,\nand David over there, I heard he doesn\xc2\x92t wear a cup.'
Yeah? I can use that, trick hip, no cup, okay! Okay!'
And uh, Liam, Liam\xc2\x92s got bad knees. You hit him right and he\xc2\x92ll\ngo down like a lamp.'
But-but, Liam\xc2\x92s on my team.'
I don\xc2\x92t care! You just get him!'
I\xc2\x92m gonna go get him! Okay, I am going back in! (Squeals like a\nmadman.)'
The Red Ross! Okay.'
Hey!'
Hi!'
(noticing a bunch of pictures around the door that weren\xc2\x92t there\noriginally.) What-what are-what are these?'
Oh, just some pictures I made and hung up. I thought they\xc2\x92d\nbrighten up the place. They do don\xc2\x92t you think?'
No-no-no, no!'
I know that there\xc2\x92s no hole there, I just really liked that\npicture.'
Oh my God! Look at this!'
Okay, but there is a wire back there! I mean that switch is\nconnected to something!'
I don\xc2\x92t care! The wires have come loose in your head!'
I just thought that if I could follow the wire I could find out what it\ndid.'
And did you?!'
No. It disappears back there behind that baseboard. For a minute there,\nI thought it went downstairs.'
But it didn\xc2\x92t. Say hello to Mrs. Chatracus.'
Oh my God.'
Hello darling.'
Hello, Mrs. Chatracus.'
Now, are you sure you don\xc2\x92t want to go see a doctor?'

Oh no! That-that\xc2\x92ll just bring me down! This was great! I mean I-I-I\nwas great! This is a great day! Y\xc2\x92know what? I\xc2\x92m buying everyone coffee. All\nright? If someone would just grab my wallet, it\xc2\x92s in my pocket. '
Yeah, sure.'
No, not you. (Emily gets it.)'
Uhh, look, your eye\xc2\x92s still popping out a little, I\xc2\x92m gonna go\nget some ice.'
Ooh, ice! I am so in the mood for ice! (They go and get the coffee and\nthe ice leaving Ross and Emily alone.)'
You were amazing out there.'
Oh, I kinda was, wasn\xc2\x92t I?'
Oh my God!'
I made a man twice my size cry. I mean, I haven\xc2\x92t done that since I\nwas four and I washed my dad\xc2\x92s Porsche with rocks.'
You really enjoyed yourself didn\xc2\x92t you?'

Please! Are you kidding? I-I hurt three huge men, I gave a guy a bloody\nnose\xc2\x97I mean I-I\xc2\x92m not proud of it but, I really am. And it\xc2\x92s all because of\nyou, wonderful, amazing you.'
I think you\xc2\x92ve got concussion.'
No, no, I\xc2\x92m serious. Thank you.'
You\xc2\x92re welcome. (She hugs him tightly and he winces.) I\xc2\x92m\nsorry. Did I hurt you?'
It\xc2\x92s worth the pain. (She goes to hug him again.) Y\xc2\x92know what,\nyou know what? It\xc2\x92s not.'
(on the P.A.) This is the final boarding call for\nFlight 664 to Yemen.'
Well, I-I guess I gotta go.'
Oh, my Bing-a-ling. I\xc2\x92ll wait for you. Do you even know how long\nyou\xc2\x92re going to be gone?'
Well, just until we find an energy source to replace fuel.'
Oh. Well, I\xc2\x92ll right you everyday. (Reading the address) 15 Yemen\nRoad, Yemen.'
Okay, good-bye. Good-bye. '
Chandler?'
No!'
Chandler! '
Janice! There you are! There you are! I had to have one last kiss, and\nalso-also you said that you were going to leave right after I got on the plane!'
No! No! I wanna see you take-off.'
Well, I then guess I\xc2\x92m going to Yemen! I\xc2\x92m going to Yemen!\n(To this old woman also going to Yemen.) When we get to Yemen, can I stay with you?'
All right. The super couldn\xc2\x92t figure out what it did. A $200 an\nhour electrician couldn\xc2\x92t figure out what it did. I\xc2\x92ve had seven pretty serious\nshocks. I officially give up.'
Thank God.'
I guess Joey was right, it does nothing.'
See? I\xc2\x92m doing it. I am totally doing it. (Suddenly it stops\nworking.) I lost it.'
